4. What will be the output of the following JavaScript code snippet?

              
              <p id="demo"></p>
var txt1 = "Sanfoundry_";
var txt2 = "Javascriptmcq";
document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = txt1 + txt2;






5. Arrays in JavaScript are defined by which of the following statements?






6. What will be the output of the following JavaScript code?
var js = 10;
js *= 5;
document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = js;






7. What will be the output of the following JavaScript program?
function sanfoundry(javascript)
{
return (javascript ? “yes” : “no”);
}
bool ans=true;
console.log(sanfoundry(ans));






8. What will be the output of the following JavaScript code? 

                    function height()
{	
    var  height = 123.56;
    var type = (height>=190) ? "tall" : "short";
    return type;
}






9. Which of the following object is the main entry point to all client-side JavaScript features and APIs?






10. What will be the output of the following JavaScript code? 

                    var x = 3;
                    var y = 2;
                    var z = 0;
                    if(x == y)
                    document.write(x);
                    else if(x == y)
                    document.write(x);
                    else
                    document.write(z);






11. Which of the following is the correct output for the following JavaScript code: 

                    function printArray(a) 
{
     var len = a.length, i = 0;
     if (len == 0)
        console.log("Empty Array");
     else 
     {
         do 
         {
             console.log(a[i]);
         } while (++i < len);
     }
}
